results.adx_keywords: Archaeology and Anthropology;Ceramics and Pottery;Historic Buildings and Sites;Mercer University;Europe;Roanoke (Va)
results.title: The Roanoke Island Colony: Lost, and Found?
results.abstract: Archaeological finds in North Carolina may provide clues to the fate of at least some of the Roanoke Island colonists who vanished in the late 1500s.

media.caption: A secluded cove off Salmon Creek near the dig site in North Carolina where archaeologists have discovered several pieces of Border ware and other materials that may suggest an early English settlement in the area.
media.copyright: Travis Dove for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Brown, Michael (1996-2014);Ferguson (Mo);Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Wilson, Darren (1986- )
results.byline: By JOHN ELIGON and MITCH SMITH
results.title: Emergency Declared in Ferguson After Shooting
results.abstract: Protesters who had commemorated Michael Brown over the weekend staged acts of civil disobedience, and officials sought to maintain calm after an overnight police shooting.

media.caption: Protesters marched in St. Louis on Monday after a weekend of commemorations of the killing a year ago of Michael Brown.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Breast Cancer;Surgery and Surgeons;Kaelin, Carolyn M (1961-2015)
results.title: Carolyn Kaelin, Breast Cancer Surgeon, Patient Advocate and Patient, Dies at 54
results.abstract: In addition to running a breast health center, Dr. Kaelin performed surgery and did research on breast cancer patients’ quality of life during and after treatment.

media.caption: The surgeon Dr. Carolyn M. Kaelin in 2007.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2016;Obama, Barack;United States Economy;Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010);Health Insurance and Managed Care;Debates (Political);Republican Party
results.title: G.O.P. Candidates and Obama’s Failure to Fail
results.abstract: Despite their overall condemnation of the Obama record, Republican candidates are oddly short on specifics.
des_facet: PATIENT PROTECTION AND AFFORDABLE CARE ACT (2010)

results.adx_keywords: Calories; Coca-Cola Company; Exercise; Global Energy Balance Network; Obesity; Soft Drinks
results.title: Coca-Cola Funds Scientists Who Shift Blame for Obesity Away From Bad Diets
results.abstract: The company supports a new nonprofit, the Global Energy Balance Network, that promotes a “science-based” approach to weight control: Get more exercise and worry less about cutting calories.

media.caption: An image from a video by the Coca-Cola Foundation. In November 2012, the foundation  announced a $3 million grant to Chicago's Garfield Park Conservatory Alliance. The grant was intended to establish a wellness program.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Football;New York Giants;Television;ABC Inc;Gifford, Frank
results.byline: By RICHARD GOLDSTEIN and BRUCE WEBER
results.title: Frank Gifford, Star for the Giants and in Broadcast Booth, Dies at 84
results.abstract: Gifford was a Hall of Fame running back and receiver who personified the Giants’ glory years of the late 1950s and early ’60s and then became a mainstay on television.

results.adx_keywords: Age, Chronological;Elderly;Women and Girls;Discrimination;Youth
results.title: I’m Too Old for This
results.abstract: Only when you hit 60 can you put yesterday’s worries behind you, the writer discovers.

results.adx_keywords: Google Inc;Alphabet;Page, Larry;Brin, Sergey;Pichai, Sundar
results.title: Google to Reorganize in Move to Keep Its Lead as an Innovator
results.abstract: Under the new name, Alphabet, the company is signaling that it has essentially become a collection of disparate businesses.

media.caption: Larry Page, co-founder and chief executive of Google.

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Teachers and School Employees;Hiring and Promotion;Shortages;California
results.title: Teacher Shortages Spur a Nationwide Hiring Scramble (Credentials Optional)
results.abstract: Just a few years after the recession caused widespread layoffs for teachers, school districts now find themselves with numerous job vacancies and few qualified candidates to choose from.

media.caption: Ashlee Pepin in her classroom in Petaluma, Calif., last month. Ms. Pepin opted not to teach as an intern while she was still earning her credentials, though many prospective teachers do.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Blacks;Discrimination;Debates (Political);Presidential Election of 2016;Race and Ethnicity;Republican Party;Carson, Benjamin S;Kelly, Megyn;Walker, Scott K
results.title: ‘Black Lives Matter’ and the G.O.P.
results.abstract: The discussion should be about more than police conduct. Officers are simply the agents of policy instituted by society as a whole.

results.title: 29 U.S. Scientists Praise Iran Nuclear Deal in Letter to Obama
results.abstract: The letter from some of the world’s most knowledgeable experts in nuclear weapons and arms control called the agreement to limit Iran’s nuclear program innovative and stringent.

results.title: Hillary Clinton to Offer Plan on Paying College Tuition Without Needing Loans
results.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton will propose major new spending by the federal government that would help undergraduates pay tuition at public colleges without needing loans.

media.caption: Hillary Rodham Clinton spoke at the National Urban League conference in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., last month.
media.copyright: Melissa Lyttle for The New York Times

results.byline: By MICHAEL MEEROPOL and ROBERT MEEROPOL
results.title: The Meeropol Brothers: Exonerate Our Mother, Ethel Rosenberg
results.abstract: A newly released transcript shows she was prosecuted mainly for refusing to turn on her husband, Julius.

results.adx_keywords: Theater;Customs, Etiquette and Manners;Smartphones;Cumberbatch, Benedict;Hamlet (Play)
results.title: Benedict Cumberbatch to Fans: No Cellphones, Please
results.abstract: The actor said it was “mortifying” during a recent production of “Hamlet” to see from stage the red light of cellphone videos recording.

media.caption: Benedict Cumberbatch performed in the director Lyndsey Turner's production of “Hamlet” at the Barbican in London last week.

results.adx_keywords: Currency;Banking and Financial Institutions;Art
results.title: Do You Have Change for a Bowie? The Advent of Artisanal Cash
results.abstract: Alternative local currencies, some depicting pop stars instead of politicians, may be the last hurrah for cash.

media.caption: A psychedelic £5 note designed by the artist Jeremy Deller for the Brixton area of London.

results.adx_keywords: Environmental Protection Agency;Rivers;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Durango (Colo);Water Pollution;Accidents and Safety;Colorado
results.title: Environmental Agency Uncorks Its Own Toxic Water Spill at Colorado Mine
results.abstract: Residents of Durango, Colo., are fuming over an E.P.A. mistake that sent three million gallons of mine waste into the town’s cultural soul, the Animas River.

media.caption: People kayaking in the Animas River near Durango, Colo., last Thursday, in water colored from a mine waste spill. The river is now closed indefinitely, with visitors warned to stay out.
media.copyright: Jerry Mcbride/The Durango Herald, via Associated Press

results.byline: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN
results.title: Hand-Wringing in G.O.P. After Donald Trump’s Remarks on Megyn Kelly
results.abstract: Mr. Trump’s suggestion that Ms. Kelly had questioned him forcefully at the Republican debate because she was menstruating cost him a speaking slot at an influential gathering.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump with his family at Thursday’s debate. Late Friday, he was disinvited from a conservative gathering in Atlanta.
media.copyright: Eric Thayer for The New York Times

results.title: A 12-Year-Old Girl, a Rape and a Bronx Neighborhood Left Unsettled
results.abstract: The unsolved sexual assault case has frustrated investigators and disturbed residents of the West Farms community, who say they cannot abide this crime.

media.caption: The alley along East 179th Street in the West Farms section of the Bronx where a 12-year-old girl said she was raped in February.
media.copyright: Robert Stolarik for The New York Times

results.title: Donald Trump Remains Defiant on News Programs Amid G.O.P. Backlash
results.abstract: In phone interviews with four Sunday programs, Donald J. Trump suggested that he had been singled out for attacks by the hosts of Thursday’s Republican presidential debate.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump during the Republican presidential debate hosted by Fox News in Cleveland on Thursday.

results.abstract: Donald Trump is the gleefully offensive showman, even as a candidate.
